revised_title: Parasitoid Resistance to Host Defense Reactions: A Comparative Study
tldr: This study compares the resistance methods of two parasitoids, Pseudeucoila bochei and Nemeritis canescens, against their insect hosts' defense reactions. While P. bochei suppresses the host's haemocytic reaction in general, N. canescens prevents encapsulation through a coating on its eggs. The two parasitoids, belonging to different groups, use distinct methods to counteract host defenses.
